title: Google\Cloud\Logging\V2\LoggingServiceV2Api
name: LoggingServiceV2Api
description:
Service Description: Service for ingesting and querying logs.

This class provides the ability to make remote calls to the backing service through method calls that map to API methods. Sample code to get started:

try {
    $loggingServiceV2Api = new LoggingServiceV2Api();
    $formattedLogName = LoggingServiceV2Api::formatLogName("[PROJECT]", "[LOG]");
    $loggingServiceV2Api->deleteLog($formattedLogName);
} finally {
    if (isset($loggingServiceV2Api)) {
        $loggingServiceV2Api->close();
    }
}

Many parameters require resource names to be formatted in a particular way. To assist with these names, this class includes a format method for each type of name, and additionally a parse method to extract the individual identifiers contained within names that are returned.

methods.name: formatParentName
methods.description: Formats a string containing the fully-qualified path to represent a parent resource.

methods.name: formatLogName
methods.description: Formats a string containing the fully-qualified path to represent a log resource.

methods.name: parseProjectFromParentName
methods.description: Parses the project from the given fully-qualified path which represents a parent resource.

methods.name: parseProjectFromLogName
methods.description: Parses the project from the given fully-qualified path which represents a log resource.

methods.name: parseLogFromLogName
methods.description: Parses the log from the given fully-qualified path which represents a log resource.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional. Options for configuring the service API wrapper.

params.name: options.serviceAddress
params.description: The domain name of the API remote host. Default 'logging.googleapis.com'.

params.name: options.port
params.description: The port on which to connect to the remote host. Default 443.

params.name: options.sslCreds
params.description: A ChannelCredentials for use with an SSL-enabled channel. Default: a credentials object returned from Grpc\ChannelCredentials::createSsl()

params.name: options.scopes
params.description: A string array of scopes to use when acquiring credentials. Default the scopes for the Google Cloud Logging API.

params.name: options.retryingOverride
params.description: An associative array of string => RetryOptions, where the keys are method names (e.g. 'createFoo'), that overrides default retrying settings. A value of null indicates that the method in question should not retry.

params.name: options.timeoutMillis
params.description: The timeout in milliseconds to use for calls that don't use retries. For calls that use retries, set the timeout in RetryOptions. Default: 30000 (30 seconds)

params.name: options.appName
params.description: The codename of the calling service. Default 'gax'.

params.name: options.appVersion
params.description: The version of the calling service. Default: the current version of GAX.

params.name: options.credentialsLoader
params.description: A CredentialsLoader object created using the Google\Auth library.

methods.name: deleteLog
methods.description:
Deletes a log and all its log entries.

The log will reappear if it receives new entries.

Sample code:

try {
    $loggingServiceV2Api = new LoggingServiceV2Api();
    $formattedLogName = LoggingServiceV2Api::formatLogName("[PROJECT]", "[LOG]");
    $loggingServiceV2Api->deleteLog($formattedLogName);
} finally {
    if (isset($loggingServiceV2Api)) {
        $loggingServiceV2Api->close();
    }
}

params.name: logName
params.description: Required. The resource name of the log to delete. Example: "projects/my-project/logs/syslog".

params.name: optionalArgs
params.description: Optional.

params.name: optionalArgs.retrySettings
params.description: Retry settings to use for this call. If present, then $timeoutMillis is ignored.

params.name: optionalArgs.timeoutMillis
params.description: Timeout to use for this call. Only used if $retrySettings is not set.

methods.name: writeLogEntries
methods.description:
Writes log entries to Stackdriver Logging. All log entries are written by this method.

Sample code:

try {
    $loggingServiceV2Api = new LoggingServiceV2Api();
    $entries = [];
    $response = $loggingServiceV2Api->writeLogEntries($entries);
} finally {
    if (isset($loggingServiceV2Api)) {
        $loggingServiceV2Api->close();
    }
}

params.name: entries
params.description:
Required. The log entries to write. The log entries must have values for all required fields.

To improve throughput and to avoid exceeding the quota limit for calls to entries.write, use this field to write multiple log entries at once rather than // calling this method for each log entry.

params.name: optionalArgs
params.description: Optional.

params.name: optionalArgs.logName
params.description: Optional. A default log resource name for those log entries in entries that do not specify their own logName. Example: "projects/my-project/logs/syslog". See [LogEntry][google.logging.v2.LogEntry].

params.name: optionalArgs.resource
params.description: Optional. A default monitored resource for those log entries in entries that do not specify their own resource.

params.name: optionalArgs.labels
params.description: Optional. User-defined key:value items that are added to the labels field of each log entry in entries, except when a log entry specifies its own key:value item with the same key. Example: { "size": "large", "color":"red" }

params.name: optionalArgs.partialSuccess
params.description: Optional. Whether valid entries should be written even if some other entries fail due to INVALID_ARGUMENT or PERMISSION_DENIED errors. If any entry is not written, the response status will be the error associated with one of the failed entries and include error details in the form of WriteLogEntriesPartialErrors.

params.name: optionalArgs.retrySettings
params.description: Retry settings to use for this call. If present, then $timeoutMillis is ignored.

params.name: optionalArgs.timeoutMillis
params.description: Timeout to use for this call. Only used if $retrySettings is not set.

methods.name: listLogEntries
methods.description:
Lists log entries. Use this method to retrieve log entries from Cloud Logging. For ways to export log entries, see Exporting Logs.

Sample code:

try {
    $loggingServiceV2Api = new LoggingServiceV2Api();
    $projectIds = [];
    foreach ($loggingServiceV2Api->listLogEntries($projectIds) as $element) {
        // doThingsWith(element);
    }
} finally {
    if (isset($loggingServiceV2Api)) {
        $loggingServiceV2Api->close();
    }
}

params.name: projectIds
params.description: Required. One or more project IDs or project numbers from which to retrieve log entries. Examples of a project ID: "my-project-1A", "1234567890".

params.name: optionalArgs
params.description: Optional.

params.name: optionalArgs.filter
params.description: Optional. An advanced logs filter. The filter is compared against all log entries in the projects specified by projectIds. Only entries that match the filter are retrieved. An empty filter matches all log entries.

params.name: optionalArgs.orderBy
params.description: Optional. How the results should be sorted. Presently, the only permitted values are "timestamp asc" (default) and "timestamp desc". The first option returns entries in order of increasing values of LogEntry.timestamp (oldest first), and the second option returns entries in order of decreasing timestamps (newest first). Entries with equal timestamps are returned in order of LogEntry.insertId.

params.name: optionalArgs.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API response. The API may return fewer values in a page, even if there are additional values to be retrieved.

params.name: optionalArgs.pageToken
params.description: A page token is used to specify a page of values to be returned. If no page token is specified (the default), the first page of values will be returned. Any page token used here must have been generated by a previous call to the API.

params.name: optionalArgs.retrySettings
params.description: Retry settings to use for this call. If present, then $timeoutMillis is ignored.

params.name: optionalArgs.timeoutMillis
params.description: Timeout to use for this call. Only used if $retrySettings is not set.

methods.name: listMonitoredResourceDescriptors
methods.description:
Lists the monitored resource descriptors used by Stackdriver Logging.

Sample code:

try {
    $loggingServiceV2Api = new LoggingServiceV2Api();

    foreach ($loggingServiceV2Api->listMonitoredResourceDescriptors() as $element) {
        // doThingsWith(element);
    }
} finally {
    if (isset($loggingServiceV2Api)) {
        $loggingServiceV2Api->close();
    }
}

params.name: optionalArgs
params.description: Optional.

params.name: optionalArgs.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API response. The API may return fewer values in a page, even if there are additional values to be retrieved.

params.name: optionalArgs.pageToken
params.description: A page token is used to specify a page of values to be returned. If no page token is specified (the default), the first page of values will be returned. Any page token used here must have been generated by a previous call to the API.

params.name: optionalArgs.retrySettings
params.description: Retry settings to use for this call. If present, then $timeoutMillis is ignored.

params.name: optionalArgs.timeoutMillis
params.description: Timeout to use for this call. Only used if $retrySettings is not set.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Initiates an orderly shutdown in which preexisting calls continue but new calls are immediately cancelled.
